items.sentence: Do you want me to tell you exactly what I did?
Do you want me to tell you what you did wrong?
Do you want to do something together sometime?
Tom will decide what we\'ll do this afternoon.
Tom said he\'d help me do what I needed to do.
Tom said he\'ll help me get everything I need.
Don\'t ever let me catch you doing that again.
Don\'t forget to say "please" and "thank you."
This is one of the best restaurants in Boston.
Nobody seemed to have a motive for the murder.
None of the books in my library are in French.
Please just get on a plane and come to Boston.
Tom didn\'t know why Mary wanted him to leave.
Tom didn\'t learn to swim until he was thirty.
Tom didn\'t like to do that when he was a kid.
Tom didn\'t live up to his end of the bargain.
Tom can\'t stand the smell of cigarette smoke.
Tom opened the shoebox and took out the shoes.
Tom studied hard so he could get into college.
It was obvious that Tom didn\'t want to leave.
